Subtitle: Eleanor? Come on in.
Eleanor? Come on in.
Hi, Eleanor. I'm Michael.
How are you today?
I'm great. Thanks for asking.
Oh, one question. Where am I?
Translation:
오, 질문이 하나 있어요 여기가 어디죠? 당신은 누구고
무슨 일이 일어나고 있는 거죠?

Subtitle: Who are you, and what's going on?
Translation:
여기가 어디죠? 당신은 누구고
무슨 일이 일어나고 있는 거죠?

Subtitle: Right, so, you, Eleanor Shellstrop, are dead.
Your life on Earth has ended, / and you are now in the next phase of your existence in the universe.
Translation:
지구에서의 당신의 삶은
끝났습니다 / 그리고 당신은 지금 우주에서
다음 단계의 존재가 됐어요

Subtitle: Cool. Cool. I have some questions.
Thought you might. [chuckles]
How did I die? I don't remember.
Translation: 제가 어떻게 죽었죠? 기억이 안 나요

Subtitle: Yes, um, in cases of traumatic or embarrassing deaths, / we erase the memory to allow for a peaceful transition.
Translation:
네, 충격적이고 당혹스러운
죽음의 경우에 / 우리는 기억을 지워서 전환이
평화롭게 이뤄지도록 합니다

Subtitle: Are you sure you want to hear?
All right, so you were in a grocery store parking lot.
You dropped a bottle of something called, "Lonely Gal Margarita Mix for One."
Translation:
당신이 병을 하나
떨어뜨렸는데, 그건 '외로운 여자를 위한
마가리타 믹스'였어요

Subtitle: And when you bent down to pick it up, a long column of shopping carts / that were being returned to the shopping cart collection area / rolled out of control and plowed right into you.
Translation:
당신이 그걸 집으려고 구부리자
쇼핑 카트 반환 구역으로 / 들어오던 긴 쇼핑 카트 행렬이 / 걷잡을 수 없이 굴러와서
당신을 덮쳤어요

Subtitle: -Oof. That's how I died? -No, sorry, there's more.
Translation: 제가 그렇게 죽었다고요? 아뇨, 미안하지만 더 있어요

Subtitle: You were able to grab on to the front of the column of shopping carts, / but it'd swept you right out into the street / where you were struck and killed by a mobile billboard truck advertising / an erectile dysfunction pill called "Engorge-ulate."
Translation:
당신은 제일 앞의
쇼핑 카트를 붙잡았지만 / 그게 당신을 길바닥으로
밀어내 버렸어요 / 거기서 당신은 이동 광고 트럭에
치여서 사망했어요 / '인고지율레이트'라는 발기 부전
치료 약을 광고하던 차였죠

Subtitle: Funnily enough, the first EMT to arrive was an ex-boyfriend of yours--
Translation:
더 재미있는 건, 현장에 도착한
첫 응급요원이 당신 전 애인이었죠

Subtitle: Okay, that's... I get it, thank you.
-Oh, okay, sorry. -Um, so who was right?
Translation: 오, 좋아요, 미안해요 그럼 누가 맞았던 거죠?

Subtitle: I mean about all of this?
Well, let's see. Hindus are a little bit right, / Muslims a little bit. Jews, Christians, Buddhists, / every religion guessed about 5%, / -except for Doug Forcett. -Who's Doug Forcett?
Translation:
글쎄요, 봅시다
힌두교도 조금 맞고 / 이슬람교도 조금은 맞죠 유대교, 기독교, 불교 모두
5% 정도는 맞혔어요 / 유대교, 기독교, 불교 모두
5% 정도는 맞혔어요 / 더그 포세트만 빼고 말이죠 더그 포세트가 누구죠?

Subtitle: Well, Doug was a stoner kid who lived in Calgary during the 1970s.
One night, he got really high on mushrooms, / and his best friend, Randy, said, / "Hey, what do you think happens after we die?"
Translation:
어느 날 밤, 마약에 잔뜩
취해 있는데 / 그의 가장 가까운 친구인
랜디가 이렇게 말했어요 / '이봐, 우리가 죽으면
어떻게 된다고 생각해?'

Subtitle: And Doug just launched into this long monologue / where he got like 92% correct.
Translation:
그러자 더그가 혼자
긴 독백을 시작했어요 / 그는 거기서 92% 정도 맞혔어요

Subtitle: [chuckles] I mean, we couldn't believe what we were hearing.
Translation:
우리는 우리 귀를 의심하지
않을 수 없었어요

Subtitle: That's him, actually, right up there.
Translation:
저게 그죠, 저 위에 있네요
여기선 꽤 유명하죠

Subtitle: He's pretty famous around here.
Translation:
저게 그죠, 저 위에 있네요
여기선 꽤 유명하죠 "더그 포세트"

Subtitle: I'm very lucky to have that.
-So... -[chuckles]
Maybe my biggest question. Am I...
I mean, is this...
Or...
Well, it's not the heaven-or-hell idea that you were raised on.
Translation:
글쎄요, 이건 당신이 생각하는 천국이냐
지옥이냐의 문제가 아니죠

Subtitle: But generally speaking, in the afterlife, / there's a Good Place and there's a Bad Place.
Translation:
하지만 일반적으로 말하면 사후 세계에는 굿 플레이스와
배드 플레이스가 있어요 / 사후 세계에는 굿 플레이스와
배드 플레이스가 있어요

Subtitle: You're in The Good Place.
-[exhales sharply] -You're okay, Eleanor.
You're in The Good Place.
Well, that's good.
Sure is. [laughs]
Okay, let's take a walk, shall we?
Oh, did I have a purse? No, I'm dead, right. Okay.
Translation: 오, 제가 지갑이 있었나요? 아니야, 난 죽었지, 됐어

Subtitle: So, this is how it works.
The Good Place is divided into distinct neighborhoods.
Translation:
굿 플레이스는 구별되는 몇 개
지역으로 나뉘어 있어요 "무한한 빛"

Subtitle: Each one contains exactly 322 people / who have been perfectly selected / to blend together into a blissful harmonic balance.
Translation:
각 지역엔 정확히 322명이 있죠 "당신이 기대한 일용품" "작은 애완동물 판매점" / 그들은 완벽하게 선별돼서 / 함께 어울려서 더없이
행복한 조화를 이루게 되죠

Subtitle: Do all the neighborhoods look like this?
No, every neighborhood is unique. Some have warm weather, some cold.
Translation:
아니요, 모든 지역은
각각 특징이 있어요 어떤 지역은 따뜻하고
어떤 지역은 추워요

Subtitle: Some are cities, some farmland.
Translation:
어떤 지역은 도시이고
어떤 지역은 농장이에요

Subtitle: But in each one, every blade of grass, / every ladybug, every detail has been / precisely designed and calibrated for its residents.
Translation:
하지만 각 지역에서는
모든 풀잎과 무당벌레와 / 하지만 각 지역에서는
모든 풀잎과 무당벌레와 모든 자세한 부분들이 / 그곳의 거주민들에게 맞게
정확히 설계되고 보정돼 있죠

Subtitle: There's a lot of frozen yogurt places.
Yeah. [sighs]
That's the one thing we put in all the neighborhoods.
Translation:
그건 우리가 모든 지역에
만들어 놓은 거예요

Subtitle: People love frozen yogurt. I don't know what to tell you.
Translation:
사람들이 프로즌 요구르트를
좋아해서요 뭘 더 말해야 할지 모르겠네요

Subtitle: You're gonna have a million more questions, I know.
Translation:
궁금한 게 셀 수 없이
많을 거예요

Subtitle: For right now, better grab a seat.
Translation:
지금 당장은 자리 잡고
앉는 게 좋겠어요

Subtitle: Movie's about to begin.
Ah. [chuckles] Hello, everyone.
And welcome to your first day in the afterlife.
You were all, simply put, good people.
Translation:
여러분은 모두 간단히 말해
좋은 사람들입니다

Subtitle: But how do we know that you were good?
Translation:
하지만 어떻게 우리가 여러분이
좋은 사람이었는지 알까요?

Subtitle: How are we sure?
During your time on Earth, every one of your actions / had a positive or a negative value, / depending on how much good or bad that action put into the universe.
Translation:
"선과 악" 여러분이 지구에 있을 때
여러분이 한 모든 행위는 / 긍정적이거나 부정적인
가치를 가졌습니다 / 그 행동이 우주에 얼마만큼의 선 또는 악을 추가했는지에
따라서 말이죠

Subtitle: Every sandwich you ate, every time you bought a magazine, / every single thing you did / had an effect that rippled out over time / and ultimately created some amount of good or bad.
Translation:
여러분이 먹은 모든 샌드위치 여러분이 산 모든 잡지, 그리고 / 여러분이 한 모든 일은 / 시간이 흐름에 따라
파급효과를 일으켜서 / 결국 어느 정도 분량의
선 또는 악을 만들어냈어요

Subtitle: You know how some people pull into the breakdown lane / when there's traffic?
Translation:
차가 막힐 때
어떤 사람들은 갓길로 / 끼어드는 거 아시죠?

Subtitle: And they think to themselves, "Ah, who cares? No one's watching."
Translation:
그리고 그들은 생각하죠
'뭐 어때? 아무도 안 보는데'

Subtitle: We were watching.
Surprise!
Anyway, when your time on Earth has ended, / we calculate the total value of your life / using our perfectly accurate measuring system.
Translation:
어쨌든, 지구에서 여러분의
시간이 끝날 때 / 우리는 여러분의 삶의
총 가치를 계산합니다 / 완벽하게 정확한 우리의
측정시스템을 이용해서요

Subtitle: Only the people with the very highest scores, / the true cream of the crop, get to come here, to The Good Place.
Translation:
가장 높은 점수를
가진 사람들만이 / 소수의 선택된 사람들만이
이곳, 굿 플레이스에 오게 됩니다

Subtitle: What happens to everyone else, you ask?
Don't worry about it.
The point is, you are here because you lived one of the very best lives / that could be lived.
Translation:
중요한 건 여러분이
여기에 있다는 사실입니다 여러분은 가능한 최고의
삶을 살았기 때문입니다 / 여러분은 가능한 최고의
삶을 살았기 때문입니다

Subtitle: And you won't be alone. Your true soulmate is here too.
Translation:
그리고 여러분은 혼자가 아닙니다 여러분의 진정한 소울메이트도
여기에 있기 때문입니다

Subtitle: -[crowd gasps and murmurs] -That's right. Soulmates are real.
One of the other people in your neighborhood / is your actual soulmate, and you will spend eternity together.
Translation:
여러분의 지역에 있는
사람 중 한 사람이 / 여러분의 실제 소울메이트입니다 그리고 여러분은 영원히
함께 할 것입니다

Subtitle: So welcome to eternal happiness.
Welcome to The Good Place.
Sponsored by...
Otters holding hands while they sleep.
You know the way you feel when you see / a picture of two otters holding hands?
Translation:
수달 두 마리가 손을
잡고 있는 사진을 볼 때 / 어떤 감정을 느끼시나요?

Subtitle: That's how you're gonna feel every day.
Translation:
그것이 여러분이 매일
느끼게 될 감정입니다

Subtitle: So who is in The Bad Place that would shock me?
Translation:
그럼 누가 배드 플레이스에 있죠?
내가 놀랄 만한 사람 말이에요

Subtitle: Uh... Well, Mozart, Picasso, Elvis, / basically every artist ever, / uh, every US president except Lincoln.
Translation:
글쎄요, 모차르트 피카소, 엘비스
기본적으로 모든 예술가와 / 피카소, 엘비스
기본적으로 모든 예술가와 / 링컨을 뺀 모든 미국 대통령이죠

Subtitle: [Eleanor] That sounds about right. What about Florence Nightingale?
Translation: 그 말이 대충 맞는 거 같아요 플로렌스 나이팅게일은요?

Subtitle: [Michael] It was close, but, no, she didn't make it.
Translation:
그녀도 여기 올 뻔했죠
하지만 오지 못했어요

Subtitle: Wow, all those amazing people down there, it just seems so hard to believe.
Translation:
와, 지구에서 그렇게
훌륭했던 사람들인데 정말 믿기 힘들어요

Subtitle: Again, it's an incredibly selective system.
Translation:
다시 말하지만, 이건 대단히
선별적인 시스템이에요

Subtitle: Most people don't make it here.
But you, a lawyer who got innocent people off death row, / you're special, Eleanor.
Translation:
하지만 당신은 변호사로서 결백한
사람들을 사형에서 구해줬어요 / 당신은 특별해요, 엘리너

Subtitle: And by the way, welcome to your new home.
Translation:
그래서 어쨌든 당신의 새집에 오신 걸
환영합니다!

Subtitle: -[Michael] Oh, it's perfect, isn't it? -[gasps]
You see, in The Good Place, / every person gets to live in a home that perfectly matches his or her true essence.
Translation:
굿 플레이스에서는
모든 사람이 자기의 / 굿 플레이스에서는
모든 사람이 자기의 본성에 완벽하게 맞는
집에 살게 되죠

Subtitle: Cool.
So I guess that's why my house, for example, / is this adorable little cottage, / whereas other people might have homes that are bigger, / like that one.
Translation:
그래서 아마도 제집은 / 이렇게 사랑스럽고
조그마한 오두막인 것 같아요 / 다른 사람들은 저것같이 / 더 큰 집을 가지겠지만요

Subtitle: [Michael] Exactly. Oh, I'm so happy you get it.
As you can see, the interior has been decorated just as you like it, / in the Icelandic primitive style.
Translation:
보다시피, 내부는 당신의
취향에 맞게 꾸몄어요 / 아이슬란드식 소박한 스타일로요

Subtitle: Oh, oh, and, uh, of course, you love clowns, so...
Translation:
오, 물론 당신이 좋아하는
광대들도 있죠, 그래서...

Subtitle: I do love clowns.
Now, let me show you the, uh, the video system here.
Translation: 이제 여기 있는 비디오 시스템을 보여줄게요

Subtitle: You can review everything that happened in your life / from your point of view.
Translation:
당신의 삶에서 일어난
모든 일을 / 당신의 관점에서
다시 볼 수 있어요

Subtitle: There we go.
This is your human rights mission to the Ukraine.
Translation:
이건 당신이 우크라이나에서
벌인 인권 활동이에요

Subtitle: I mean, you got a ton of points for that one.
It really put you over the top.
Oh.
Chidi, come on in.
Eleanor? I'm Chidi Anagonye, / and you are my soulmate.
Translation: 엘리너? 난 치디 아나곤예입니다 / 당신의 소울메이트죠

Subtitle: Cool! Bring it in, man.
Now, excuse me. I have other people to attend to.
Translation: 전 이만 실례할게요 돌봐드릴 다른 사람들이 있어서요

Subtitle: So where you from, Chidi?
Well, I was born in Nigeria, raised in Senegal, / but my work took me all over the place.
Translation:
전 나이지리아에서 태어나서
세네갈에서 컸어요 / 하지만 일은 여러 곳에서 했어요

Subtitle: Australia, Hong Kong, Paris.
What about you?
Uh, well, I... I was born in Phoenix.
-Mmm-hmm. -Arizona.
And then I went to school in Tempe, Arizona.
Translation:
그리고 학교는 애리조나 주
템피에서 다녔어요

Subtitle: And then I moved back to Phoenix, Arizona.
Your English is amazing.
Oh! I'm actually speaking French.
This place just translates whatever you say / into a language the other person can understand.
Translation:
전 실제로는 프랑스어로
말하고 있어요 여기서는 무슨 언어를 하든지 / 다른 사람이 이해할 수 있는
언어로 번역을 해주죠

Subtitle: -So it's incredible. -Whoa.
-And now I want to say this. -Mmm-kay.
Translation: 이제 이 말을 하고 싶어요 좋아요

Subtitle: Eleanor.
I have spent my entire life in pursuit of fundamental truths about the universe.
Translation:
난 내 전 생애를 우주에 관한 근본적 진리를
탐구하는 데 바쳤어요

Subtitle: And now we can actually learn about them together as soulmates.
Translation: 이제 우리가 함께 소울메이트로서 이걸 배워나갈 수 있어요

Subtitle: It's overwhelming.
Chidi. You'll stand by my side no matter what, right?
Translation:
치디 당신은 무슨 일이 있어도
내 편이 돼 줄 거죠?

Subtitle: -Of course I will. -Promise me. Say, "I promise / I will never betray you for any reason."
Translation:
물론이에요 약속해줘요, '약속해요' / '절대 어떤 일이 있어도 당신을
배신하지 않을게요'라고 해줘요

Subtitle: Eleanor, I swear / that I will never say or do anything / to cause you any harm.
Translation:
엘리너, 맹세해요 / 전 당신에게 어떤 해를 주는 / 말을 하거나 그런 행동을
하지 않을 거예요

Subtitle: Good.
Because those aren't my memories.
I wasn't a lawyer. I never went to the Ukraine.
Translation:
전 변호사가 아니었어요
전 우크라이나에 간 적이 없어요

Subtitle: I hate clowns.
There's been a big mistake.
I'm not supposed to be here.
Wait, what?
Are you sure this isn't you?
Yeah, man, I'm pretty sure I wasn't a death-row lawyer / who collected clown paintings and rescued orphans.
Translation:
네, 그래요, 아주 확실해요
난 사형 전문 변호사가 아니었어요 / 그림을 수집하지도, 고아들을
구호하지도 않았고요

Subtitle: They got my name right, but nothing else.
Translation:
그들이 제 이름은 맞혔지만
나머지는 다 틀렸어요

Subtitle: I mean, somebody royally forked up. [chuckles]
Somebody forked up.
Why can't I say "fork"?
If you're trying to curse, you can't here.
Translation:
여기선 욕을 하려고 해도
할 수가 없어요

Subtitle: I guess a lot of people in this neighborhood / don't like it, so it's prohibited.
Translation:
이 지역의 많은 사람이 / 그걸 싫어할 거예요
그래서 금지되어 있어요

Subtitle: That's bull-shirt.
So, if you're not this person, then who are you?
Translation:
당신이 이 사람이 아니라면
그럼, 당신은 누구죠?

Subtitle: What did you do for a living?
I was... In...
Sales.
So we sell two products here, NasaPRO and NasaPRO Silver.
Translation:
우린 여기서 두 가지 제품을 팔죠
나사프로와 나사프로 실버예요

Subtitle: We aim this at seniors.
Now, you can't legally call it "medicine"
Translation:
이건 법적으로 약이라고
할 수 없어요

Subtitle: because it doesn't technically work / and it is technically chalk, so what you're gonna want to do--
Translation:
왜냐하면 기술적으로
그런 효능이 없으니까요 / 이건 기술적으로 분필이에요
그래서 당신이 해야 할 일은...

Subtitle: You need me to lie to old people and scare them into buying fake medicine.
Translation:
노인들에게 거짓말하고 겁을 줘서
가짜 약을 사게 하라는 거네요

Subtitle: I get it, man. Which one's my desk?
So your job was to defraud the elderly...
Translation:
그럼 당신의 일은 노인들에게
사기 치는 거였군요?

Subtitle: Sorry, the sick and elderly?
But I was very good at it.
Translation: 하지만 전 그 일을 아주 잘했어요

Subtitle: I was the top salesperson five years running.
Okay, but that's worse.
I mean, you, you do get how that's worse, / right?
Translation:
그게... 당신은 왜 그게
더 나쁜지 알죠? / 그렇죠?

Subtitle: You know, maybe it's a test.
Maybe if you go to Michael and you tell him the truth, / you'll pass the test / -and you'll get to stay. -No way.
Translation:
만일 당신이 마이클한테 가서
진실을 말한다면 / 당신은 그 시험을
통과하는 거예요 / - 그래서 머물게 될 거예요
- 안 돼요

Subtitle: I can't risk going to The Bad Place.
Translation:
배드 플레이스에 가는 위험을
감수할 수는 없어요

Subtitle: Okay, well, maybe it's not actually, like, all that bad.
Translation:
좋아요, 그래도 그렇게 하는 게
아주 나쁘지는 않을 거예요

Subtitle: Let's just get some information first.
We'll ask Janet. Hey, Janet?
-Hi there. -[exclaims]
How can I help you?
What the fork? Who are you?
I'm Janet.
I'm the informational assistant here in The Good Place.
Translation:
저는 이곳 굿 플레이스의
정보 도우미입니다

Subtitle: She's like this walking database.
You can ask her about the creation of the universe, or history--
Translation:
그녀에게 우주의 창조
또는 어떤 역사를 물어볼 수...

Subtitle: Oh, there was a guy who lived in Avondale, Arizona, around 2002.
Translation:
오, 2002년경에 애리조나의
애본데일에 살던 남자가 있어요

Subtitle: His name was Kevin Paltonic.
-Is he gay? -No.
Really?
Huh. I guess he just didn't want to have sex with me.
Translation:
그는 그냥 나하고 섹스하기가
싫었던 거군요

Subtitle: That's correct.
Well, that's fine, I wasn't that into him anyway.
Translation:
괜찮아요, 나도 그 남자를
그렇게 좋아하지 않았어요

Subtitle: -Yes, you were. -Okay, Janet, I have a question.
Translation:
- 그렇지 않아요
- 좋아요, 재닛 - 내가 질문이 있어요
- 말씀하세요

Subtitle: -Okay. -What is The Bad Place like?
Oh, sorry, that is the one topic I'm not allowed to tell you about.
Translation:
미안해요, 그건 제가 당신한테
말해선 안 될 한 가지 주제예요

Subtitle: I can only play you a brief audio clip of what is happening there right now.
Translation:
지금 거기서 일어나는 일에 대한
짧은 녹음을 들려드릴 수는 있어요

Subtitle: Okay.
[woman] The bear has two mouths!
Well, it doesn't sound awesome.
Does everyone have a huge house except me?
Translation:
나만 빼고 모든 사람이
큰 집을 가지고 있나요?

Subtitle: All right, we need a plan.
I say we just lie low and hope that they don't notice me.
Translation:
우린 그냥 조용히 있으면서
그들 눈에 안 띄기만 바라야죠

Subtitle: I'm sorry, I don't think I can help you.
Translation:
미안해요, 전 당신을 도울 수
없을 것 같아요

Subtitle: I just don't like being dishonest, / and I can't advise you to be dishonest either.
Translation:
전 거짓말하는 게 그냥 싫어요 / 그리고 당신도 거짓말하라고
조언할 수는 없어요

Subtitle: Come on, I'm just asking you to fudge a little bit.
Translation:
난 그저 당신한테 적당히
얼버무려 달라고 부탁하는 거예요

Subtitle: You must've told a few white lies in your life.
Translation:
당신도 살면서 선의의 거짓말은
분명히 해봤을 텐데요

Subtitle: I mean, what was your job?
I was a professor of ethics and moral philosophy.
Mother-forker!
-I'm getting a stomachache. -[sighs]
I'm in a perfect utopia, / and I'm... I have a stomachache. This is awful.
Translation:
전 완벽한 낙원에 있어요 / 그런데 배가 아프다니
이건 끔찍해요

Subtitle: I, uh... I think I have to tell Michael about this.
[Michael] Tell Michael about what?
[Eleanor] Michael? Hi.
What have you been up to?
Eleanor, Chidi, I would like you to meet Tahani and Jianyu.
They are soulmates and your next-door neighbors.
Hello.
Can I just say I love your house?
Translation:
당신 집이 참 좋다고
말씀드리고 싶어요

Subtitle: It's just so tiny and cute.
It's like a little child's plaything, like for a family of mice / or for a very fancy little dog.
Translation:
마치 아이들 장난감 같은데
생쥐 가족이나 / 아주 예쁜 작은 개를
위한 것 같아요

Subtitle: I love it. It's just so sweet and teensy.
Translation:
그게 마음에 들어요
너무 아늑하고 작아요

Subtitle: Just like you. Boop.
You booped me. [laughs]
-I did. -That's fun.
Tahani and Jianyu are having a little / welcome party tonight, and they've invited the entire neighborhood.
Translation:
타하니와 지안유가 오늘 밤 / 작은 환영 파티를 열 거예요
그들은 전 이웃을 초대했어요

Subtitle: Oh, I simply adore entertaining.
Don't I just adore it, Jianyu?
Oh, yes, by the way, Jianyu here is a Buddhist monk, you see, / and he obeys a strict code of silence.
Translation:
오, 그래요, 그런데 지안유는
불교 수도승이에요, 아시겠죠? / 그리고 그는 엄격한
침묵 서약을 지키고 있어요

Subtitle: So when you see him smiling and nodding, / that's actually his way of jumping up and down with glee.
Translation:
그래서 그가 미소를 짓고
고개를 끄덕이는 건 / 실제로는 기뻐서
껑충껑충 뛰는 거죠

Subtitle: Isn't that right, darling?
So we'll see you tonight?
-Great. -Yes.
-[chuckles] -No way.
My entire house could fit in this room.
Translation:
내 집 전체가 이 방에
다 들어가겠어요

Subtitle: Okay, uh...
Help me out here.
Tell me one good thing that you did on Earth, / just one truly kind and decent act / so that I can feel better about helping you out.
Translation:
지구에서 했던 좋은 일
하나를 말해보세요 / 진심으로 친절하고 제대로 된
행동 하나만 말이에요 / 그래야 당신을 돕는 거에 대해
기분이 나아질 거 같아요

Subtitle: Let's forget about good.
Um, just tell me something neutral about yourself.
Translation:
그냥 당신 자신에 관해 뭐든
중립적인 거 말해보세요

Subtitle: Like, tell me about the day before you died.
Translation:
예를 들어, 당신이 죽기
전날에 대해 말해주세요

Subtitle: What do you remember?
Hi there. Do you have a second to talk about the environment?
Translation:
안녕하세요, 환경에 대해 잠깐
얘기할 수 있을까요?

Subtitle: Do you have a second to eat my farts?
You missed.
[scoffs] Pick it up if you're so horny for the environment.
Translation:
당신이 주워요 환경에 그렇게 관심이
많다면 말이에요

Subtitle: I don't remember anything specific.
-Oh... -Look.
I might not have been a saint, but it's not like I killed anybody.
Translation:
난 성인은 아니었는지 몰라요
하지만 사람을 죽이진 않았어요

Subtitle: I wasn't an arsonist.
I never found a wallet outside of an IHOP
and thought about returning it but saw the owner lived out of state / so just took the cash and dropped the wallet back on the ground.
Translation:
그걸 돌려줄까 생각했지만
주인이 다른 주에 사는 걸 알고는 / 현금을 약간 빼고 그걸 다시
땅에 던져 놓는 짓은 안 했어요

Subtitle: Okay, that's really specific, / and that makes me think that you definitely did do that.
Translation:
좋아요, 정말 구체적이군요 / 그래서 당신이 확실히 그렇게
했다는 생각이 드네요

Subtitle: All I'm saying is these people might be "good,"
Translation:
내 말이 뭐냐 하면, 이 사람들은
아마 '선'할지 모르죠

Subtitle: but are they really that much better than me?
Translation:
하지만 그들이 정말로
나보다 훨씬 나을까요?

Subtitle: Well, I spent half my life in North Korea / fighting for women's rights and the other half in Saudi Arabia / fighting for gay rights.
Translation:
글쎄요, 난 내 삶의 절반을
북한에서 보내며 / 여성의 권리를 위해 싸웠어요
나머지 반은 사우디아라비아에서 / 동성애자들의 권리를 위해 싸웠죠

Subtitle: So we said, "If the UN won't remove those land mines, we will."
Translation:
그래서 만약 UN이 지뢰를
제거 안 하면 우리가 한다고 했죠

Subtitle: And we dug up over a thousand unexploded land mines / from the area surrounding the orphanage.
Translation:
우린 천 개가 넘는 폭발하지 않은
지뢰를 파냈어요 / 보육원을 둘러싸고 있는
지역에서 말이에요

Subtitle: Well, then he said, / "You can't give me both your kidneys, you'll die."
Translation:
그런데 그가 말했어요 / '당신 신장 2개를 나한테
모두 주면 당신은 죽어요'

Subtitle: And I said, "But you will live."
And I know we just met on this bus ten minutes ago, but he seemed nice.
Translation:
우린 10분 전에 그 버스에서
만났죠, 하지만 그는 좋았어요

Subtitle: Oh, forget it. Heading to the bar!
Translation:
오, 더 못 듣겠어요
바로 가겠어요!

Subtitle: Thank you, thank you.
You all know that I am the architect of this neighborhood.
Translation:
여러분 모두 제가 이 지역의
설계자라는 걸 압니다

Subtitle: But what you don't know is...
Golly, I'm not supposed to tell you this, but, um...
Translation:
이런, 여러분에게 이 얘기는
해서는 안 되는데

Subtitle: Oh, what the heck?
This is actually the very first neighborhood / that I have ever designed.
Translation: 이건 실제로 제가 설계한 / 제일 첫 지역입니다

Subtitle: I had been an apprentice for over 200 years, / and my boss has finally given me my first solo project.
Translation:
전 200년 동안 견습생이었어요 / 그리고 제 상관이 마침내 저의
첫 단독 프로젝트를 줬죠

Subtitle: Yes! [laughs]
Ah, ah, ah. Hold on there, ace.
Let me get more of them shrampies.
-Okay, easy. -What?
-They're for everybody, right? -Yes, exactly.
Translation:
이건 모든 사람을 위한
거잖아요? 맞아요

Subtitle: [Michael] And you deserve a perfect world / because every single one of you / is a good person.
Translation:
여러분은 완벽한 세상에
있을 자격이 있습니다 / 왜냐하면 여러분 모두가 / 좋은 사람이기 때문이죠

Subtitle: That's it for me. Back to you, Tahani.
-Bravo, Michael, bravo! -Thank you.
And I would just like to quickly say / if any of you would like to play tennis tonight, / we have 36 regulation grass tennis courts.
Translation:
그리고 잠깐 공지해드릴게요 / 혹시 오늘 밤 테니스 치고
싶은 분이 계신다면 / 우린 36면의 정식 잔디
테니스 코트가 있어요

Subtitle: Such fun. Cheers. [laughs]
Tahani, what a condescending bench.
-Okay, okay, okay, okay. -Am I right?
Why does she still have that British accent, right?
Translation:
왜 그녀는 아직도
영국 억양을 쓰죠, 그렇죠?

Subtitle: No one else here has an accent.
-She's choosing to have that accent. -[shushes]
Translation:
그녀는 일부러 그 억양을
쓰기로 작정한 거예요

Subtitle: [imitating Tahani] "Oh, hello.
I am just a big, beautiful, utterly perfect cartoon giraffe."
Translation:
'전 그냥 크고 아름답고 완벽한
만화에 나오는 기린이에요'

Subtitle: Oh, okay. Okay. I think it's time to go home.
Translation:
오, 알겠어요
이제 집에 갈 시간 같아요

Subtitle: Wait, wait, wait. I just have to go upstairs / real quick and steal a bunch of gold stuff.
Translation:
잠깐만요, 2층에
올라가 봐야겠어요 / 정말 재빨리 가서
금붙이를 훔쳐야겠어요

Subtitle: Okay, don't do that.
Don't do... No, Eleanor, Eleanor, Eleanor.
Hello, creepy house that I hate.
Hello, one million clowns.
Why aren't there stairs here?
What kind of weirdo house is this?
Did you fill your bra with shrimp?
No. [hiccups]
Yes.
Whatever, it's freakin' heaven.
I'm sure they have plenty of shellfish.
Translation:
틀림없이 그들은 조개류를
많이 갖고 있을 거예요

Subtitle: That Tahani is a real butthead, huh?
[gasps] Hey.
At least I can still say "butthead."
Oh, she is a butthead.
Found some pajamas.
Chidi... Chidi, Chidi?
I'm sorry that you had to deal with this...
It's okay.
It's not, though. [sighs]
Do you think anybody cared that I died?
Translation:
내가 죽었다는 걸 누가
신경이나 쓴다고 생각해요?

Subtitle: Maybe someone did. I don't know.
I was an only child.
My parents were divorced when I was a kid.
They were both crummy people, so they're probably... [exclaims]
Translation:
그들은 형편없는 분이었어요
그래서 두 사람 모두 아마...

Subtitle: In The Bad Place.
Maybe they're being used to torture each other.
Translation:
아마 그분들은 서로 고문하는 데
익숙해지고 있을 거예요

Subtitle: -It would work. -[chuckles]
I bet way more people cared that you died.
Translation:
분명 당신의 죽음에는 더 많은
사람들이 관심을 가졌을 거예요

Subtitle: 'Cause you're a nice person. [clears throat]
You're a nice person, Chidi...
Anaconda.
-"Anagonye." -Aganocomonga.
"Anagonye."
-Ags... say it again. -"Anagonye."
-No, say what you said before. -I did. It's Anagonye.
Translation:
아니요, 그 전에
말한 걸 말해봐요 했잖아요, 그건 아나곤예예요

Subtitle: -You just changed it. -I didn't change it, it's my name.
Translation: 방금 바꿨어요 안 바꿨어요, 그게 내 이름이에요

Subtitle: Argrugande. Ariana Grande.
[gasps] That's a person.
I did it.
Good night. Good night.
Well, that's terrifying.
That can't be good.
[Eleanor] Oh, fork.
-Michael. -Hmm?
Is that giant, terrifying ladybug supposed to be there?
Translation:
저 거대하고 무서운 무당벌레가
저기 있어야 하나요?

Subtitle: Ah. Well, great question, Tahani.
No. No, it's not.
I have no idea why any of this is happening or how to control it.
Translation:
왜 이런 일이 일어나는지 또 어떻게 통제해야 하는지
난 전혀 몰라요

Subtitle: Should we run away then?
Yes.
Righto.
Chidi, Chidi! What's going on?
Why are there giant animals everywhere?
Translation:
왜 거대한 동물들이
여기저기 있는 거죠?

Subtitle: Do you hear Ariana Grande playing?
Translation:
아리아나 그란데 노래
나오는 거 들리나요?

Subtitle: Why is everyone wearing blue and yellow?
Translation:
왜 모두 파랗고 노란 옷을
입고 있는 거죠?

Subtitle: You're not.
You're the only one who's not.
Eleanor, this is all happening because of you.
Oh, fork me.
Okay, okay. We don't know this is because of me.
Translation:
좋아요, 이게 나 때문인지
우린 몰라요

Subtitle: Eleanor, this place is a perfectly made Swiss watch, / and you are a wrench in the gears.
Translation:
엘리너, 이곳은 완벽하게
만들어진 스위스 시계예요 / 그리고 당신은 톱니바퀴에
던져진 연장이죠

Subtitle: Actually, you're a hammer, just smashing the gears into dust.
Translation:
사실 당신은 망치예요, 톱니바퀴를
부숴서 먼지로 만들어 버리죠

Subtitle: Oh, hang on. Not everybody here is perfect, okay?
Translation:
기다려요, 여기 모든 사람이
완벽하진 않아요, 알았어요?

Subtitle: Tahani is totally condescending.
And there are a couple of, you know, chunksters.
Oh, come on!
No judgment. I'm just saying / I'm not the only one with flaws. So how can we be sure this is my fault?
Translation:
판단하지 말아요
난 그냥 나만 결점이 / 있는 건 아니라는 거예요, 어떻게
이게 내 잘못이라고 확신하죠?

Subtitle: You hogged all the shrimp, and now there are shrimp flying around.
Translation:
당신은 새우를 독차지했어요
그리고 지금 새우가 날아다니고요

Subtitle: You called Tahani a giraffe, and now there are giraffes everywhere.
Translation:
당신이 타하니를 기린이라고 했죠
지금 기린이 사방에 있어요

Subtitle: Okay, fine, turns out there are many ways to know that it was me.
Translation:
좋아요, 그게 나 때문이라는 걸
아는 많은 방법이 있는 거군요

Subtitle: Let's just face it, Eleanor, you don't belong here.
Translation:
현실을 직시해요, 엘리너
당신은 여기 속하지 않아요

Subtitle: Well, then this system sucks.
What, one in a million gets to live in paradise / and everyone else is tortured for eternity?
Translation:
뭐라고요, 백만 명 중
한 사람이 낙원에 살고 / 나머지 사람들은 모두
영원히 고문을 받는다고요?

Subtitle: Come on.
I mean, I wasn't freaking Gandhi, but I was okay.
I was a medium person.
I should get to spend eternity in a medium place!
Translation:
난 미디엄 플레이스에서
영원히 머물러야 해요

Subtitle: Like Cincinnati.
Everyone who wasn't perfect but wasn't terrible / should get to spend eternity in Cincinnati.
Translation:
완벽하진 않지만
끔찍하지도 않은 모든 사람은 / 신시내티에서 영원을
보내게 해야 해요

Subtitle: Look, apparently it doesn't work that way.
Translation:
이봐요, 분명히 그런 식으로
시스템이 작동하진 않아요

Subtitle: I'm sorry, Eleanor, but there's nothing anyone can do.
Translation:
미안해요, 엘리너, 하지만
아무도 뭘 할 수 없어요

Subtitle: Unless...
There is something we can do. Unless you could teach me.
Translation:
우리가 뭔가를 할 수도 있겠죠 만약에 당신이 나를
가르칠 수 있다면요

Subtitle: -Teach you what? -How to be good.
Translation: 당신한테 뭘 가르치죠? 좋은 사람 되는 법요

Subtitle: That was your job, right? A professor of ethics?
Translation:
그게 당신 직업이었어요, 그렇죠?
윤리학 교수라고 했죠?

Subtitle: No one knew I was a problem when I arrived.
Translation:
내가 도착했을 때 아무도 내가
문제라는 걸 몰랐어요

Subtitle: Things only started getting crazy / after I was an ash-hole to everyone at the party. Ugh.
Translation:
상황이 엉망이 되기 시작한 건 / 내가 파티에서 사람들에게
바보같이 굴면서부터였어요

Subtitle: You know I'm trying to say "ash-hole" and not "ash-hole," right?
Translation:
내가 '바보같이'를 말하려 할 때
제대로 발음 안 되는 거 알죠?

Subtitle: I got that, yes.
Okay, give me a chance. Let me earn my place here.
Translation:
좋아요, 나한테 기회를 줘요
이곳에 내 자리를 얻도록 해줘요

Subtitle: -Let me be your ethical guinea pig. -[knocking on door]
Translation:
내가 당신의 윤리적
실험 대상이 될게요

Subtitle: [Michael] Hey, guys! Uh... Emergency neighborhood meeting, now!
Translation:
이봐요! 비상 동네 회의가
있어요, 당장요!

Subtitle: We'll be right there, Michael!
If I walk out of here in these clothes, I'm toast.
Translation:
내가 이 옷을 입고 여기를
걸어나가면, 난 끝이에요

Subtitle: My soul is in your hands, soulmate. What's it gonna be?
Translation:
내 영혼은 당신 손에 달렸어요
소울메이트, 어떻게 할 거예요?
